thread.title: Comedy Central gives full season order to ‘Detroiters’
thread.title_full: Comedy Central gives full season order to ‘Detroiters’

author: detroitnews.com
title: Comedy Central gives full season order to ‘Detroiters’
text:
The series, which follows two Detroit-area advertising workers, has been picked up by the cable network IMAGE DISTRIBUTED FOR THE TELEVISION ACADEMY - Sam Richardson arrives at the 67th Primetime Emmy Awards on Sunday, Sept. 20, 2015, at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles. (Photo by Danny Moloshok/Invision for the Television Academy/AP Images) (Photo: Danny Moloshok / Invision for the Television Academy) 
3 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE “Detroiters” is coming to Comedy Central.
The cable network has ordered a 10-episode run of the series, Deadline.com reports, which stars ex-“Saturday Night Live” cast member Tim Robinson and “Veep’s” Sam Richardson, both Metro Detroit natives. The show is executive produced by “SNL” vet Jason Sudeikis.
Sudeikis will have a limited role on the show, which stars Robinson and Richardson as two Detroit-area ad guys looking to make it big.
The pilot episode for the series was filmed locally, although no announcement has been made whether the rest of the episodes will be filmed in Metro Detroit.
No air date for the series has been set.
agraham@detroitnews.com 
@grahamorama
